Description: Funerary papyrus of Candace containing Second Book of Breathing (abridged version) written in hieratic script. First line on the recto is written in hieroglyphs. Greek text on the verso.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Egypt, Thebes. Found with P. BM EA 9978 in the collective tomb of the archon Soter (see Herbin 2008, 103).
Curator's comments: Bibliography: Herbin, F.-R., Books of Breathing and Related Texts (Catalogue of the Books of the Dead and Other Related Texts in the British Museum IV), London, 2008, pp. 103-104, pls. 62-63.
Bibliographic references: Quirke 1993 / Owners of funerary papyri in the British Museum (40)
Herbin 2008 / Books of Breathing and Related Texts (pp.103-104, pls.62-63)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (57771) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/57771)
